Interesting sculpture. Absolutely huge and a really fun photo spot. Tulips looks a little like a little child's toy (or adult toy, depending on your point of view) now you've seen it, you won't unsee it.

"Bouquet of tulips" is a sculpture made by Jeff Koons, it was a gift from the USA to France. It's just behind the Petit Plais so a 2 minute detour for a photo is definitely worth it.

The Bouquet of Tulips is a stunning modern-art addition to Paris' artistic landscape. The sculpture was only installed in 2019 and stands around 12m tall. The tulips symbolize hope and resistance (the most known meaning of tulips is perfect and deep love, ideal for someone you a deep unconditional love for).  Located near the Petit Palais I stumbled on the sculpture by accident on a walking tour of the city. The sculpture was the work of Jeff Koons, him of pop art fame and the world's most expensive living artist, and adds another sculpture to a list of famous Franco-American sculptures .. the most famous one being the Statue of Liberty.
very cool. actually the coolest! very realistic. def a must visit in paris

Incredible sculpture behind the Petit Palais. Get closer and observe the details, it becomes even more interesting up close. Take the opportunity to enjoy the surrounding garden and visit the Petit Palais, which is free and has a café with a garden inside.

on the way close to the Grand Palais to Paris in 2024 after 11 years 8km walk in the sun in the middle of winter, we loved every corner and every detail of the monument and the gardens walking with the beloved woman

As you pass through the Champs Elysées from Place de la Concorde, you will see a large colorful monument on your left. It was a peaceful and nice space.
Seen from afar this bouquet of tulips in the Parisian night. Superb in this garden.

Bouquet of Tulips Walking suddenly among the trees this spectacular sculpture appears, a hand with a bouquet of tulips. I find it beautiful.

Intriguing but colorful sculpture.

“The Bouquet of Tulips”, This is a sculpture by the American artist Jeff Koons.  Despite all the controversies that caused the final location of this beautiful modern work, its meaning continues to be very precious and carries a message of peace after the attacks of 2015 and 2016.
surprising sculpture, very colorful with the Eiffel Tower in the background. Thank you for this gift in tribute to the victims of the attacks
